newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Light started as buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Light started as buy.

text.p: ABN AMRO Hoare Govett analyst Alvaro Valenzuela started coverage of Brazil's Light Servicos de Eletricidade SA Tuesday with a rating of buy.

-- "Light's shares are set to provide better-than-average returns for the rest of the decade, as demand for electricity grows and the company benefits from continuing cost reductions," he wrote in an analysis.
-- Valenzuela set a 12-month price target for the power distributor's shares of $650, or 767 reais, per 1,000 shares.
-- "We expect earnings per 1,000 shares of $30.36 in 1997 and $40.69 in 1998, while cash earnings should be $41.10 and $51.30 for 1997 and 1998, respectively."
-- Light was up four reais to 515 reais in Sao Paulo.
